title: Paul Rudd reveals he ran over Jennifer Aniston's FOOT with a Segway while filming Friends
text:
He's known for his entertaining performances on the big screen, but Paul Rudd has revealed his attempts at comedy on set haven't always gone down so well.

Speaking on Friday night's edition of The Graham Norton Show, the Ant-Man star, 50, reminisced about his time filming Friends and a quite literal run-in with actress Jennifer Aniston.

The actor revealed that during his first episode for the hit US series Jennifer, 50, was using a Segway because she had broken her toe, but when he tried it out he accidentally rolled over her injured foot.

Funny: Paul Rudd, 50, pictured on The Graham Norton Show in London on Thursday, revealed he ran over Jennifer Aniston's foot with a Segway while filming his first episode of Friends

Paul said: 'I was on the set for my first episode and Jennifer was on a Segway because she had broken her toe, and everyone was marvelling at it.

'Matt LeBlanc asked to have a go and immediately knew how to do it. I then asked to try it too. I spun round and rolled it right over Jennifer's foot!

'The producers look of panic was if to say, "Is it too late to fire him? Has his character been established yet?" I felt awful. Such an inauspicious start.'

This wasn't the only awkward encounter with Jennifer, who played Rachel on the show which is celebrating 25 years, that Paul had during filming.

Awkward run in: Jennifer, pictured with Paul at the premiere of their 2012 film Wanderlust, had been using a Segway to help her get around on set after breaking her toe

He explained that while on set for the final episode which aired in 2004 he tried to comfort the actress, but things didn't go to plan.

Paul said: 'The show was a phenomenon and I was in the very last episode, which made no sense to me whatsoever.

'I was on the sound stage and Jennifer Aniston was crying and I thought, "I'm not supposed to be here", so to break the ice I went over and said, "Well, we did it, what a ride." The joke inevitably fell flat!'

Despite these awkward stories to look back on, Paul said the chance to be in Friends for 18 episodes as Phoebe's partner Mike was amazing.

End of an era: Paul, second right, was in the finale in 2004, despite only being in 18 episodes and he said while filming he tried to comfort Jennifer, third left, but his joke fell flat

Throwback: Paul played Mike Hannigan and ended up marrying Phoebe Buffay (, who was played by Lisa Kudrow, in the final season

He said: 'It was an incredible thing to be part of and the whole experience, but seems a bit surreal and a bit of a blur in my memory.'

Paul and Jennifer also worked together in the 1998 film The Object Of My Affection, which tells the story of a pregnant New York City social worker who decides she'd rather raise her child with her gay best friend.

More recently, they played married couple George and Linda Gergenblatt who move from Manhattan to a rural commune in the 2012 film Wanderlust.

Since then Paul has gone on to star in hit Marvel film Ant-Man as well as Parks and Recreation.

His next project is Netflix series Living with Yourself, where a man is replaced by a new and improved version of himself.

What a line up: Bruce Springsteen, Robert De Niro, Sienna Miller and James Blunt also appeared on the talk show which will air at 10.35pm on Friday

Acting talent: While speaking about acting two different characters for his new Netflix show, Paul said: ' I cannot believe I am talking about how to act in front of Robert De Niro'

While on Graham Norton, Paul explained how he kept the premise of the story clear in his head while playing both main characters.

He said: 'I really got into playing two different people but it was nuanced, not all Jekyll and Hyde, it was about the hair, the physicality and posture…'

However when he remembered he was with fellow guests and actors Robert De Niro, Sienna Miller, Paul stopped mid-sentence.

He said: 'I cannot believe I am talking about how to act in front of Robert De Niro. I feel like a high-school science student talking about black holes sitting next to Stephen Hawking.'

Singers Bruce Springsteen and James Blunt also appeared on the show, which will aira at 10.35pm.
